title.value: The phytoplankton structure of ponds and watercourses of the Vilejka fish farm [Belarus]
Структура фитопланктона прудов и системы водотоков рыбоводческого хозяйства 'Вилейка' [Беларусь]

journal.title: Belarus Fish Industry Problems : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Adamovich, B.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus). Institute for Fish Industry

abstract.value: The phytoplankton structure of the Vilejka fish farm ponds and watercourses which are its water sources and water intakes – the Vilia and the Smerdia rivers is studied. It is determined that the phytoplankton development level in the large Vilia River is comparable to the development level in fish farm ponds exposed to targeted trophic increase. The fundamental difference in the taxonomic phytoplankton structure between all studied ecosystems is noted. A significant impact of the farm on the small Smerdia river phytoplankton in some years during the water discharge from the pond is determined. The fundamental difference in the taxonomic phytoplankton structure in the Vilia River and Smerdia River evidences the fact that phytoplankton of the Smerdia River, which is the Vilia River tributary, has virtually no effect of the phytoplankton formation directly in Vilia. When injected into the flow, tributary phytoplankton specimen are replaced by the well-formed algoflora of the Vilia River watercourse.
